data.title: US Patent Issued to MURATA MANUFACTURING on April 30 for "Antenna device and communication apparatus" (Japanese Inventors)
meta_keywords: US Patent Issued to MURATA MANUFACTURING on April 30 for
data.meta_description: US Patent Issued to MURATA MANUFACTURING on April 30 for
data.text:
Posted On: 2024-05-01

ALEXANDRIA, Va., May 1 -- United States Patent no. 11,973,279, issued on April 30, was assigned to MURATA MANUFACTURING Co. LTD. (Nagaokakyo, Japan).

"Antenna device and communication apparatus" was invented by Dai Futagami (Nagaokakyo, Japan) and Takaya Nemoto (Nagaokakyo, Japan).

According to the abstract* released by the U.S. Patent & Trademark Office: "A patch antenna is constituted by a radiation element disposed on a substrate and a ground conductor disposed in the substrate. A dielectric member is disposed to cover the radiation element and a body of a resin material is disposed to cover the dielectric material as viewed from above. The dielectric member is disposed on a side opposite a side on which the ground conductor is dispose...
